items.title: Pilots’ body warns DGCA fatigue plan could risk safety
items.summary:
- *ALPA India* warns that DGCA's proposed *Fatigue Risk Management System (FRMS)* could become a tool for operators to extend duty periods unless strict safeguards are in place.
- It urges delaying nationwide adoption until the final probe report into the Air India crash is completed and related safety recommendations on fatigue are incorporated.
- It calls for FRMS to be implemented as a *Civil Aviation Requirement (CAR)* after broad stakeholder consultations, with independent pilot oversight and measurable safety benchmarks.

items.title: India's exports rise 6.7% to $35.1 bn in Aug
items.summary:
- India’s *exports* rose 6.7% to **$35.1 bn** in August, while *imports* fell 10.1% to **$61.6 bn**, narrowing the trade deficit to **$26.5 bn**.
- Commerce secretary *Sunil Barthwal* attributes the gain to four pillars: *competitiveness*, market diversification, resilient supply chains, and better market access.
- The government pursues export growth via ~50 market strategies, a ₹25,000 crore package, and faster India–**EU** trade talks.

items.title: Consumers stay high on sugar-based products
items.summary:
- *Institutional sugar consumption* climbs to 60-65% in 2023-24 from 50-55% in 2018-19, even as FMCG players claim to reduce sugar.
- The largest segments are *non-alcoholic beverages* (35-40%) and *confectionery* (15-18%), driven by mid-income and rural demand for sugar-rich foods.
- Affluent households move toward low-sugar options while *mid-income* groups maintain high refined sugar use, signaling a clear income-based bifurcation.

items.title: F&B sector drives growth in retail leasing
items.author: Kailash Babar; ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The *F&B sector* is reshaping *retail real estate*, driving demand for high streets and malls.
- Data from JLL shows about *4 million sq ft* of leasing in the top seven cities and F&B's share rising to *22%* of retail activity in 2025.
- By 2028, roughly *6 million sq ft* of new F&B space is expected, with developers dedicating up to *25%* of space in destination malls.

items.title: PM Modi pushes jointness, innovation at Commanders' Meet
items.summary:
- PM Modi urged the defence ministry to swiftly implement steps for greater *jointness*, *atmanirbharta* and *innovation* to meet evolving battlefield needs.
- He spoke at the three-day **Combined Commanders Conference (CCC) 2025** in Kolkata, underscoring reforms and future plans for the coming years.
- The conference will review structural, administrative and operational matters to enhance *military preparedness* amid evolving global uncertainties.

items.title: Megha wins ₹5,700-cr private SPR project
items.summary:
- Megha Engineering & Infrastructures Ltd has won a *₹5,700-crore* mandate to build and operate India’s first **private-sector strategic petroleum reserve** at Padur, Karnataka.
- The project aims to store *2.5 million metric tonnes* of crude oil at Padur, with **five years** to build and **60 years** to operate, boosting India's SPR capacity from **39 million barrels**.
- The deal marks Megha's shift from *EPC contractor* to SPR operations, enabling revenue from leasing and trading while **ISPRL** oversees emergency preparedness.

items.title: US reinterprets arms pact to ease drone exports
items.summary:
- The United States reinterprets export controls to treat drones as fighter jets rather than missiles, easing approvals under the *MTCR*. 
- The policy unlocks larger drone sales, including more than 100 MQ-9s to Saudi Arabia and expanded deals to the UAE and Eastern Europe, amid competition from Israel, China and Turkey. 
- Major manufacturers such as General Atomics, Kratos, and Anduril can join *foreign military sales*, enabling easier international deals.

items.title: India's smartphone exports cross ₹1 lakh crore; Apple leads
items.summary: - India's smartphone exports crossed *₹1 lakh crore* in the first five months of FY26, setting a new record.\n- *Apple*'s contract manufacturers, *Tata Electronics* and *Foxconn*, accounted for nearly *75%* of outbound shipments.\n- The *US market* and the *PLI scheme* helped India become a manufacturing hub, with *78%* of domestically assembled iPhones destined for the US in H1 2025 and a *44%* share of US imports.

items.title: India’s IT eyes chip, electronics foray
items.author: Beena Parmar
items.summary:
- *Wipro’s $375 million stake in Harman’s Digital Transformation Solutions—and its tie-ups with Samsung—signal IT majors expanding into electronics and semiconductors.*
- *Infosys, Cyient, L&T, TCS with Tata Electronics, HCLTech with Foxconn and Intel Foundry deals show India building an end-to-end semiconductor ecosystem with government backing.*
- *India’s semiconductor market could rise from ~$45-50B in 2024–25 to ~$100-110B by 2030, while the global market nears $2T by 2032, fueling GenAI-driven demand.*

items.title: Recycling rare earths to ease supply gaps
items.summary:
- The McKinsey report warns that BEVs and wind demand will triple by 2035, while primary supply remains highly concentrated in *China*, risking gaps that *circular recycling* could help bridge.
- It projects about 40 kt of pre-consumer and 41 kt of post-consumer REE scrap by 2035, underscoring the potential of *circular REE magnet value chains* despite labor-intensive dismantling and smelting losses.
- Promising pathways include *robotic disassembly*, hydrogen-based processing, and bulk metallurgical methods to unlock significant secondary REE supply from devices.

items.title: NTPC looking to set up standalone nuclear projects: Chairman
items.summary:
- **NTPC** aims to set up nuclear power projects through both joint ventures and on a *standalone basis*, per *CMD Gurdeep Singh*. 
- It is collaborating with *technology providers* and **state governments** to explore individual nuclear projects. 
- NTPC's current installed capacity stands at about 82,926 MW across coal, liquid fuel, hydro and solar, signaling a diversified portfolio.

items.title: Goa gets its first hazardous waste treatment plant
items.summary:
- *Goa* has commissioned its first *hazardous waste* treatment and disposal plant at Pissurlem, Sattari, a ₹125 crore project by *Ponda Envocare Limited (PEL)* under state oversight. 
- The facility combines landfill, *incineration*, and pre-processing with capacity to handle landfillable, incinerable, and co-processing waste, with live monitoring for *safety*. 
- It will create local jobs (about 80% of workers Goan) and prevent contamination through strict *safety* protocols.

items.title: India's D2M chip at IBC; 5G delay to 2028
items.summary:
- At IBC 2025 in Amsterdam, *India* showcased an indigenously designed *D2M* (Direct to Mobile) broadcasting chip with broad device support, signaling market readiness.
- Qualcomm indicated the first wave of *5G Broadcast* silicon will ship only in 2028 and will appear on new premium devices, not as a standalone chip.
- Policy momentum and global interest (e.g., *Brazil*) could accelerate *India's indigenous semiconductor ecosystem*, bringing *D2M* to hundreds of millions of feature-phone users.

items.title: Applied Materials eyes India Semicon Mission partners
items.summary:
- *Applied Materials* is in talks with ISM partners like SiCSem and HIPSPL to supply equipment and software in India. 
- The company seeks to support SCL Mohali upgrades and Tata's Dholera fab with local offices and logistics, while training staff from regional hubs. 
- Bengaluru remains a key R&D hub; they plan more hiring and to attract suppliers such as Horiba, Rockwell, Merck and Linde to India.

items.title: Chip companies grapple with import curbs on raw materials
items.author: Subhrojit Mallick, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Semiconductor firms face hurdles in importing critical raw materials such as *gold wire*, *solder paste*, epoxy compounds and lead frames due to licensing and duties.
- Industry proposes a 10-year zero-duty import regime under the *IGCR* framework to boost cost competitiveness and reduce import dependency.
- About 25 materials, including solder balls, gold-coated copper wires, palladium and *silver epoxy syringes*, require *DGFT* licences and are hard for small players to source.

items.title: BJD rally over fertiliser scarcity near Raj Bhavan
items.summary: - *BJD* workers protested in Odisha to highlight the 'acute scarcity' of fertilisers, staging a rally near *Raj Bhavan* and leveling allegations against the administration.\n- The protest turned tense when demonstrators tried to breach barricades; police used mild force but later allowed some leaders to enter *Raj Bhavan* to submit a memorandum.\n- Leaders warned the agitation could intensify and spread if demands aren't met, citing high fertiliser prices and alleged mismanagement by the government.

items.title: Japanese investments surge in Karnataka
items.summary:
- *Sumitomo Corporation* is investing **₹2,345 crore** in a greenfield steelmaking facility in Koppal, while *Honda* plans **₹600 crore** EV unit in Narasapura and *JFE Shoji* earmarks **₹400 crore** for NGEF revival in Hubballi.
- Currently, about *50%* of Japanese companies operating in India are based in Karnataka, which is expanding alliances with top firms like *Yaskawa*, *Air Water*, *Yamaha Robotics*, *Konoike*, *Mitsubishi Electric*, and *Yokogawa Electric* to cement its status as a manufacturing hub.
- Beyond these deals, *Shinko Nameplate* (₹100 crore) and *Cataler* (₹140 crore) are expanding, with *Hitachi*, *Renesas*, *Asahi Kasei*, *Saginomiya*, and *Inabata* boosting activity in the state.

items.title: GREW Solar launches new PV modules at RE+ 2025
items.summary: - GREW Solar unveiled the *All-Black Series* for US rooftops and the *G2G M10 TOPCon Series* (≤590 W) at RE+ 2025, both *UFLPA-compliant* for US entry. - It plans to boost Jaipur capacity from 3 GW to 11 GW and is building an 8 GW PV cell facility at Narmadapuram, MP, by 2026 for backward integration. - CEO Vinay Thadani says the launches show Indian firms can meet global standards, with RE+ 2025 marking its strongest entry into the *North American market*.

items.title: India targets 5% global shipbuilding by 2030
items.summary:
- **5%** of the global shipbuilding market by 2030, backed by 10 shipyards through **PPP** and international collaboration, with automation and *green shipbuilding*. 
- A **national container shipping line** by 2030 and the goal to domestically produce half of container vessels by 2035, reducing reliance on foreign operators. 
- The **Maritime Development Fund** will finance shipyard modernization and green R&D, aiming for 30% of ships on clean fuels by 2047 and PM Gati Shakti–enabled multimodal connectivity.

items.title: AI to bridge half India's growth to $8.3T by 2035
items.summary:
- *AI* adoption and R&D in India could halve the growth gap to **$8.3T** by 2035, guided by the **AI for Viksit Bharat** roadmap and targeting **8%+ growth**.
- Two unlocks: **30-35%** from AI adoption and **20-30%** from generative AI, with near-term gains for *financial services* (**$50–55B**) and *manufacturing* (**$85–100B**).
- Looking ahead, pharma could cut discovery costs by **30%** and timelines by **80%**, while 18–20M software-enabled cars by 2035 may yield **$20–25B** in gains, signaling an **AI-led growth** path.

items.title: Avaada unveils 11 solar plants under MSKVY in Maharashtra
items.summary:
- Avaada Group unveils 11 solar plants in Maharashtra under *MSKVY 2.0* to deliver daytime irrigation power and advance *clean energy transition*. 
- The 11 plants total MW: Kinhi 4, Baldi 3, Dongarkharda 3, Bansi 2, Patan 2, Mhasola 5, Galwa 2, Pathrad 4, Parjana 4, Sawargaon 3, Sarfali 3 MW. 
- About *14,900 farmers* in *167 villages* will benefit via lower costs and leases; MSKVY 2.0 targets ~7,000 MW of decentralised solar to 30% of agricultural feeders.

items.title: Let miners realize the fuller benefit of low-grade iron ore
items.summary:
- India faces a glut of *low-grade ore* (below 58% Fe) with most Goan ore around 54% Fe, limiting domestic steelmaking.
- Extending *export duties* to fines could hurt revenues, employment, and investment; a phased 5% duty after a three-year window is recommended to build beneficiation capacity.
- A balanced approach monetizes fines via exports while developing domestic processing, protecting regional states like Goa and Karnataka and preserving market linkages.

items.title: Sterling Gtake–Landworld EV parts in India
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- The Sterling Gtake–Landworld Technology partnership will manufacture *on-board chargers* and *DC/DC converters* for EVs in India, with production at its *Faridabad* campus.
- The deal is projected to generate about ₹450 crore in revenue by *FY30*, with the overall market for these components around ₹3,000 crore.
- It aligns with *Make in India* and *Atmanirbhar Bharat* goals to localize production, reduce imports, and expand from motor-control units to *multifunction power-electronics solutions*.

items.title: GST 2.0 reforms: A game-changer for India’s manufacturing
items.summary:
- *GST 2.0* rests on three pillars—**structural reforms**, **rate rationalisation**, and **ease of doing business**—to unlock capital and boost competitiveness for Indian manufacturers.
- It fixes inverted duty structures and improves tax credits to give freer working capital, lower input costs, and stronger export potential through a more *Make in India* aligned framework.
- The reforms will boost sectors from Automotive to MSMEs, support Atmanirbhar Bharat, and position India as a **global manufacturing powerhouse** through sustained investment and innovation.

items.title: India aims to be a Green Hydrogen hub, creating jobs
items.summary: - India aims to become a global hub of *green hydrogen* innovation and manufacturing, creating *high-value jobs*.\n- **Targets 5 MMT/year by 2030**, with **₹8 lakh crore** in investments and the potential to create about **6 lakh jobs**, while reducing fossil fuel imports.\n- With a Net Zero goal by 2070, the mission aims for R&D, pilots and international partnerships to sustain long-term leadership in clean energy.

items.title: HZL marks Engineers’ Day: 55% engineers in exec roles
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *HZL* marks Engineers’ Day by noting engineers account for **55%** of its executive workforce, underscoring reliance on technical skills.
- Over 1,490 executive engineers, including more than 270 *women engineers*, are driving automation, safety, and decarbonisation across the mining and metals business.
- The company highlights women-led mine management, and talent programs like VLDP, GET, PGET and MT to future‑proof its talent pool.

items.title: India smartphone exports cross ₹1 lakh crore; Apple leads
items.author: IANS
items.summary: - *₹1 lakh crore* in value in the first five months of FY26 signals a record.\n- Apple-led shipments, via Tata Electronics and Foxconn, accounted for about *75%* of exports, aided by the *PLI* scheme.\n- The US is the primary market for exports, with *Made-in-India* devices expanding share and volumes rising.

items.title: Indian Navy gets anti-submarine warfare ship
items.summary:
- *Androth*, the second ASW Shallow Water Craft built by **GRSE**, is delivered to the Indian Navy, boosting its maritime capabilities.
- The vessel, ~77 metres long, is part of eight ASW-SWC ships and features over 80% indigenous content under **Aatmanirbhar Bharat**.
- Equipped with lightweight torpedoes and indigenous anti-submarine rockets, it strengthens coastal surveillance and self-reliant defence.

items.title: Vikram Solar to supply 200 MW solar modules to AB Energia
items.summary:
- *Vikram Solar* has won a 200 MW order to supply high-efficiency modules to **AB Energia**, an end-to-end EPC for commercial and industrial solar projects.
- The 590 Wp+ **M10R N-Type TOPCon** modules will be deployed across Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, and Gujarat to boost clean energy adoption.
- Deliveries start in **September 2025** and run through early 2026, underscoring Vikram Solar's 4.5 GW capacity and presence in 39 countries.

items.title: KKR-backed Serentica to buy Statkraft's solar power business
items.summary:
- **Serentica Renewables**, backed by **KKR**, will acquire Statkraft's India solar business for an enterprise value of about **$220-250 million**. 
- It **outbid rival Blackstone** and a formal announcement is expected within days. 
- The deal adds roughly **1.5 GW** of solar capacity (plus hydropower assets) to Serentica's portfolio.

items.title: Tata Technologies buys German company ESTEC for ₹750 cr
items.author: Shally Mohile, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Tata Technologies to acquire Germany's ESTEC for ₹750 crore to bolster its *software-defined vehicle* capabilities and establish a Europe base.
- ESTEC's 300-strong team brings *ADAS* and comfort electronics expertise, complementing Tata Tech's strengths in infotainment and e-powertrains, with the deal expected to be accretive to profitability and EPS from day one.
- The acquisition expands Tata Tech's European strategy, with plans to grow teams in Germany, Morocco and India, while avoiding *headcount rationalisation* and pursuing further strategic targets.

items.title: IDTA fund to boost semiconductors and AI infra
items.author: Suraksha P, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- IDTA, launched at Semicon India 2025 with a $1B commitment, is expected to channel a substantial share to *semiconductors* and *AI infrastructure*.
- Sriram Viswanathan of *Celesta Capital* says private capital will be crucial for de-risking, helping fabless chip design, and enabling cross-border partnerships and global customer access.
- India’s policy tailwinds from the **India Semiconductor Mission (ISM)** and incentives are meant to spur domestic demand, manufacturing, and ecosystem development for semiconductors and AI data centers.

items.title: China crude steel output falls for third month on curbs
items.summary:
- August crude steel output was *77.37 million tons*, down 0.7% YoY and 2.9% from July.
- Average daily output in August was *2.5 million tons*, vs *2.57 in July*, as Tangshan and other plants constrained for cleaner air.
- Eight-month total reached *671.81 million tons*, down 2.8% YoY amid demand slowdown and curbs.

items.title: Apple deepens ties to Kentucky plant for iPhone glass
items.summary:
- **Apple** and **Corning** will shift production at the *Harrodsburg* plant to supply 100% of the iPhone and Apple Watch cover glass. 
- **Apple** has committed about **$2.5 billion** to expand capacity, create up to 500 jobs, and open an innovation center at the site. 
- By the end of 2026, all cover glass for the iPhone and Apple Watch will be manufactured in Kentucky.

items.title: China probes US semiconductors ahead of Madrid talks
items.summary:
- China launched two probes targeting the **US semiconductor sector** ahead of Madrid talks on trade and security, including an anti-dumping review of analog ICs and gate-driver chips from the US.
- The ministry also opened an anti-discrimination probe into US measures against China's chip sector.
- In Madrid, US officials and Chinese counterparts discuss de-risking strategic industries like **semiconductors** amid export curbs and an expanded **entity list** of Chinese firms.

items.title: India’s IT eyes chip-electronics foray
items.summary:
- *India’s top IT firms* are diversifying into electronics and semiconductors, *leveraging engineering and R&D strength* to glide past growth bumps.
- They are pursuing acquisitions and partnerships across the *semiconductor value chain*—design, OSAT, and wafer fabs—to de-risk dependence on imports.
- Industry leaders say bold bets and policy support could make India a *global hub for semiconductor design and manufacturing* in the long term.

items.title: Titagarh launches third DSC for Indian Navy
items.summary:
- Titagarh Rail Systems launched the third **Diving Support Craft (DSC)** for the Indian Navy, under the *Make in India* initiative.
- The DSCs are catamaran-type vessels to support the Navy's *Command Clearance Diving Teams* in underwater repair, maintenance and salvage, and will also serve as training platforms.
- Umesh Chowdhary, MD of TRSL, says the project strengthens *indigenous naval capabilities* and *defence manufacturing*, reinforcing Titagarh's role in India's maritime build.

items.title: Kerala gets ₹100 cr food & life-sciences hub at Angamaly
items.summary:
- **RCC Nutrafill**'s **Angamaly facility** is a Rs 100-crore hub blending food processing with life sciences to spur a local industrial ecosystem.
- Spread over five acres and slated for completion in 24 months, it will house cold storage, warehousing, R&D, logistics, and create about 500 jobs.
- The project underlines Kerala's commitment to innovation-led growth with government support to set a benchmark in sustainable manufacturing.

items.title: Airbus, Thales, Leonardo eye satellite tie-up
items.summary:
- *Airbus Defence and Space* chief *Michael Schoellhorn* says *Leonardo*, *Thales*, and *Airbus* could sign an initial satellite-tie-up this year.
- The plan uses a two-step process: a framework agreement, then a closing, with signing possibly as early as 2025.
- The initiative, called **Project Bromo**, would create a satellite-manufacturing firm to compete with **Starlink**.

items.title: The next leap: How India is building sovereign smart manufacturing
items.summary:
- *India's Edge-first strategy* uses local *Edge MES* and *SLMs* to keep data sovereign with low latency while staying connected to global supply chains.
- The government serves as an infrastructure builder, establishing standards and open networks like **ONDC for Manufacturing** and promoting state-level specialization.
- The plan aims to attract talent, cut costs and latency, and shift global manufacturing terms toward Indian data sovereignty.

items.title: How private players are driving India’s defence manufacturing boom
items.author: Paras Nath
items.summary:
- Private Indian firms are ramping up *defence manufacturing*, leveraging R&D and reverse‑engineering to modernise ageing platforms beyond the PSU era. 
- Government moves like *DAP 2020*, *Production Linked Incentive (PLI)* schemes and the *Defence Industrial Corridors* in UP and Tamil Nadu are boosting private‑public collaboration and easing licensing for startups and legacy players. 
- This private‑public synergy, aligned with *Make in India* and *Atmanirbhar Bharat*, could position India as a future global defence exporter and reshape the strategic landscape.

items.title: GST not on post-sale dealer discounts: CBIC clarifies
items.summary:
- Post-sale discounts from manufacturers to dealers for competitive pricing are *not subject to GST*.
- GST applies only when a dealer provides promotional services (e.g., advertising, co-branding) under a defined agreement.
- *CBIC* clarifies the distinction between *trade discounts* and separate services, reducing disputes and boosting certainty for businesses.

items.title: Defence sec calls for industry-R&D-academia synergy
items.summary: - *STRIDE 2025* spotlighted deeper industry–R&D–academia collaboration to strengthen India’s indigenous defence ecosystem.\n- He warned of turbulent geopolitics and urged building hard power with *AI*, *quantum-secure communications*, *drones*, and resilient cyber infrastructure, emphasizing the private sector’s role.\n- The seminar highlighted reforms, DRDO’s catalytic role, and a Whole-of-Nation approach to scale defence manufacturing for a self-reliant *Bharat*.

items.title: Industry seeks PLI to boost agrochemicals & cut imports
items.summary:
- ACFI urges a **PLI scheme** and tax holidays to cut *import dependence* for key inputs and to build domestic agrochemical hubs.
- The Deloitte report highlights India as a major exporter (about USD **3.3B** in 2024-25) and warns of supply shocks from imports.
- Calls for stronger *Public-Private R&D* and MSME support to ease doing business and boost local production.

items.title: Godrej Aerospace bags 5-year Safran contract to supply LEAP engine components
"Electronics that go into defence will have dual use": Defence Secretary Rajesh Kumar Singh
Haryana eyes ₹5,000 crore investment in medical device manufacturing
Shree Refrigerations aims for top-3 in data centre cooling
items.summary:
- SRL signs MoU with Smardt Chillers to bring **magnetic-bearing** cooling tech for data-centre environments.
- The shift from defence to data centres targets energy savings (20–40% in part-load) and a data‑centre revenue share of about 10–15%, with naval orders still dominant.
- SRL aims to be among the top-3 players in India's data centre cooling market within five years, leveraging its naval legacy and new technology.

items.title: Industry optimistic about growth in auto parts exports despite tariffs
items.summary:
- *India's $80B auto components industry* faces a limited long-term impact from US/Mexico tariffs due to relatively low exposure, with exports of about $6.6B to the US and $0.5B to Mexico.
- Industry leaders expect a rebound driven by India's *cost edge* and a shift toward resilient supply chains, with opportunities in **wiring harnesses** and **ICE powertrain parts**.
- *Multi-sourcing* and a potential **EU FTA** could spur growth, but tariffed parts and geopolitical uncertainty keep decision-making cautious.

items.title: Govt likely to pick 7 AI startups for IndiaAI incentives
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The government is likely to shortlist Avataar.ai, Tech Mahindra, Fractal Analytics, Genloop, IntelliHealth, Shodha AI and Zenteiq Aitech Innovations for incentives under the **IndiaAI Mission**.
- **BharatGen** is also among the shortlisted firms, with final beneficiaries expected to be announced soon by the electronics and IT ministry.
- The **IndiaAI incentives** program has drawn hundreds of applications since January, with ₹1,500 crore allocated to fund AI models, including large reasoning models.
